channel.title: INtech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: UK quietly scrubs encryption advice from government websites
item.description: The UK is no longer recommending the use of encryption for at-risk groups following its iCloud backdoor demands © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved...

item.title: Here's a Map of the For-Sale Government Properties the GSA Pulled From Its Website
item.description: The General Services Administration plans to sell hundreds of government buildings, including FBI headquarters. Use our interactive tools to see where...

item.title: Infineon teams up with India’s CDIL to build chips for light EVs, energy storage solutions
item.description: Infineon Technologies has partnered with CDIL Semiconductors to tap into emerging business cases including light EVs and battery storage solutions in ...

item.title: Alpine Eagle secures funding from European backers for counter-drone tech amid rising threats
item.description: The war in Ukraine has brought drones to the forefront of modern warfare, creating a surge in demand for counter-drone systems. However, legacy soluti...

item.title: Revlon One-Step Volumizer Plus Review: Hot Looks for Less
item.description: This blow-dry brush performs just as well as its pricey competitors, give or take a little frizz.

item.title: DOGE’s $1 Federal Spending Limit Is Straight Out of the Twitter Playbook
item.description: On this special episode of Uncanny Valley, we talk about Elon Musk’s move to put spending limits on US government employee credit cards, plus how DOGE...

item.title: A quarter of startups in YC’s current cohort have codebases that are almost entirely AI-generated
item.description: With the release of new AI models that are better at coding, developers are increasingly using AI to generate code. One of the newest examples is the ...

item.title: This Goopy Seaweed Slurry Could Make Its Way Into Everything You Eat and Wear
item.description: A startup called Marine Biologics is breaking down seaweed into its base components so they can be used for a range of consumer applications, from foo...

item.title: The Weird and Wacky Gadgets We Saw at MWC 2025

item.title: Renaissance Fusion raises €32M to radically simplify complex fusion reactors
item.description: The startup is betting that by simplifying stellarators, it can make fusion power cheaper and easier to maintain. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserv...
